quote: Where are the quotes?
author: Yousef Yousef

quote: Quotes ain’t all that useful. Fact is, there’s more concise ways to express what you’re feelin’, like screams and moans.
author: M.C. Humphreys

quote: Always be wary of people who use quotes. I don't know who said that.' - Murdoc Niccals
author: Gorillaz,  Gorillaz: Rise of the Ogre

quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays

quote: Stupid quotes are only Twitters in disguise.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Inspirational quotes are dances of light that shine in dark places during your life.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Quotation confesses inferiority.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Uncollected Writings

quote: People that love quotes are those short on time, but long on big ideas.
author: Bruce Edwin

quote: Quotes are made we to think, we have made a mistake so quotes will put us in the right way? (But can we understand them - is the best question)
author: Deyth Banger

quote: Every quote is like a Picasso. The meaning is different for each person and half the admirers miss the true intent and twisted humor of it all.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Life itself is a quotation.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Quote words that affirmall men and women are yourbrothers and sisters.
author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams

quote: I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: I love when people quote me. It makes me feel that my words have meaning. People give words power. When they speak out for things they feel, we all become alive.
author: Jennifer Megan Varnadore

quote: I have a self-made quote: Celebrate diversity, practice acceptance and may we all choose peaceful options to conflict.
author: Donzella Michele Malone

quote: I wish, when I was first born, the first thing I said was "Quote"so the last thing I said before I died would be "Unquote.
author: Steven Wright

quote: I'm not an inspirational quote kind of person.
author: Christine Teigen

quote: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: #quote In the harshest conditions is when we know better the people around us. En las condiciones más duras es cuando conocemos mejor a las personas que nos rodean.
author: Juan Luis Ortiz Hidalgo,  Las mil vidas del profesor Bonham

quote: Under loves heavy burden do I sink.--Romeo
author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet

quote: Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting.
author: John Green

quote: Just living is not enough,"said the butterfly, "one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
author: Hans Christian Andersen,  The Complete Fairy Tales

quote: The truth is not always beautiful, nor beautiful words the truth.
author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching

quote: The poet's job is to put into words those feelings we all have that are so deep, so important, and yet so difficult to name, to tell the truth in such a beautiful way, that people cannot live without it.
author: Jane Kenyon

quote: It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: [A] quotation is a handy thing to have about, saving one the trouble of thinking for oneself, always a laborious business."(The Record Lie)
author: A.A. Milne,  If I May

quote: Famous people steal my quotes all of the time without knowing; none of it is ever very interesting though.
author: Robert DeCoteau,  The New Days: The First Son

quote: ❞ [10w] "Let's cuddle like a quotation mark filling a blank page.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: The best writing speaks when the heart whispers.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: I don't think writers are sacred, but words are. They deserve respect. If you get the right ones in the right order, you might nudge the world a little or make a poem that children will speak for you when you are dead.
author: Tom Stoppard,  The Real Thing: A Play

quote: ‎"With each experience we grow and become more aware of the inner beauty that lies within us. Ultimately we are truly our own leader. We lead the connection and flow of life that is our inheritance.
author: Rabbi Yossi

quote: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: In quoting others, we cite ourselves.
author: Julio Cortázar,  Around the Day in Eighty Worlds

quote: Poetry heals the wounds inflicted by reason.
author: Novalis

quote: It goes with a courageous intent to greet the universe as it really is, not to foist our emotional predispositions on it but to courageously accept what our explorations tell us.
author: Carl Sagan,  The Varieties of Scientific Experience: A Personal View of the Search for God

quote: Writer speaks a stench.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Kind words change the world.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: For you, my love, I would endeavor to pluck the stars from the sky, only to shower them at your feet.”“How do you do that?’“Do what?”“Say things like that. That’s beautiful.”“I’ve spent years studying poetry, Mrs. Emerson. It’s in my DNA.
author: Sylvain Reynard,  Gabriel's Redemption

quote: re-examine all you have been told in school or church or in any book, and dismiss whatever insults your own soul; and your very flesh shall be a great poem, and have the richest fluency, not only in its words, but in the silent lines of its lips and face, and between the lashes of your eyes, and in every motion and joint of your body.[From the preface to Leaves Grass]
author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass

quote: Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer,  Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

quote: Beauty is the virtue of the body as virtue is the beauty of the soul
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Poetry is just so emo."he said. "Oh, the pain. The pain. It always rains. In my soul.
author: John Green,  Paper Towns

quote: I know the world is filled with troubles and many injustices. But reality is as beautiful as it is ugly. I think it is just as important to sing about beautiful mornings as it is to talk about slums. I just couldn't write anything without hope in it.
author: Oscar Hammerstein II

quote: Headline?"he asked."'Swing Set Needs Home,'"I said."'Desperately Lonely Swing Set Needs Loving Home,'"he said."'Lonely, Vaguely Pedophilic Swing Set Seeks the Butts of Children,'"I said.
author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Stories make us more alive, more human, more courageous, more loving.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: I choose to live in peace today. I choose to get lost in my inner beauty today.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When you write from the heart, it is always beautiful.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Why is everything always my decision?"I asked.Because you will not tolerate anything else."Oh, I remembered now. "Great", I whispered.- Anita to Jean-Claude
author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Cerulean Sins
